# init()

**Initializer**

Creates a hash function.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Discussion

Initialize a new hash function by calling this method if you want to hash the data iteratively, such as when you don’t have a buffer large enough to hold all the data at once. Provide data blocks to the hash function using the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction/update(data:)] or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction/update(bufferPointer:)] method. After providing all the data, call [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction/finalize()] to get the digest.

If your data fits into a single buffer, you can use the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction/hash(data:)] method instead to compute the digest in a single call.

## Computing a hash iteratively

- **update(data:)**: Incrementally updates the hash function with the given data.
- **update(bufferPointer:)**: Incrementally updates the hash function with the contents of the buffer.
- **finalize()**: Finalizes the hash function and returns the computed digest.
